body.notes: I was supposed to make caramel sauce but I let the sauce boil for about 5 or 10 mins too long.

ingredients: 1 c butter, softened at room temp
method: The recipe for CRUST (above) makes TWO 9-inch tarts. To be even more technical, it makes about 2.2 9-inch tarts. I made the dough and froze half of it.
Form a dough ball. Add a few spoons of water (I think I ended up using about 6 tbsp?
Split in half (or, 0.45, 0.45, and 0.10. You can use the 0.10 to make one mini tart). Freeze. It is way easier to roll out once defrosted for a few hours
Roll out and put into a 9-inch (20cm) pie pan. Trim edges against top of pie pan
Microwave white sugar and water for 1 min.
Beat eggs. Add milk and vanilla. Add sugar water (add slowly if it isn't cool)
Pour egg mixture through a sieve, into pie pan
Trim edges of pie crust until crust rises about 1 cm above the egg mixture.

Bake on middle rack of oven, at 350F for about 30 minutes and at 375F for about 15 minutes (40-45 min total). Or bake at 375F first and then lower the temperature to 350F when the crust looks done. The custard should look kind of filmy at the top and obviously not be liquid.
body.notes: Just keep checking on it until it looks done...

body.intro: Soft rye bread with fresh fennel! Oven spring was amazing (1-2 cm?), although the top collapsed slightly after about 30 minutes.
